poem:
### The Unseen Scroll

A father's voice  
drowned in the digital tide—  
Molly's silence,  
a weight too fragile  
for wires and codes.  
Lost faith spirals  
through cold, uncharted waves,  
seeking anchors  
in vacant fields,  
where eyes fade  
into endless scrolls.  
A lost call echoes  
for the watchmen  
of screens  
to awaken.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Father of teen whose death was linked to social media has ‘lost faith’ in Ofcom The father of Molly Russell, a British teenager who killed herself after viewing harmful online content, has called for a change in leadership at the UK’s communications watchdog after losing faith in its ability to make the internet safer for children. Ian Russell, whose 14 year-old daughter took her own life in 2017, said Ofcom had “repeatedly” demonstrated that it". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
